symbols.doc: The symbols used in the schema to specify e.g. dimensions of arrays

symbol.name: nfa
symbol.doc: Number of fast axes (axes acquired symultaneously, without scanning a pysical quantity)

symbol.name: nsa
symbol.doc: Number of slow axes (axes acquired scanning a pysical quantity)

definition.doc: Subclass of NXinstrument to describe a photoelectron analyser.

field.name: description
field.doc: Free text description of the type of the detector

field.name: name
field.doc: Name or model of the equipment

field.name: energy_resolution
field.doc: Energy resolution of the electron analyser (FWHM of gaussian broadening)

field.name: momentum_resolution
field.doc: Momentum resolution of the electron analyser (FWHM)

field.name: angular_resolution
field.doc: Angular resolution of the electron analyser (FWHM)

field.name: spatial_resolution
field.doc: Spatial resolution of the electron analyser (Airy disk radius)

field.name: fast_axes
field.doc:
List of the axes that are acquired simultaneously by the detector. These refer only to the experimental variables recorded by the electron analyser. Other variables such as temperature, manipulator angles etc. are labeled as fast or slow in the data.
.. csv-table:: Examples :header: "Mode", "fast_axes", "slow_axes"
Hemispherical in ARPES mode, "['energy', 'kx']","" "Hemispherical with channeltron, sweeping energy mode", "", [\"energy\"] "Tof", "['energy', 'kx', 'ky']","" "Momentum microscope, spin-resolved", "['energy', 'kx', 'ky']", "['spin up-down', 'spin left-right']"
Axes may be less abstract than this, i.e. ['detector_x', 'detector_y']. If energy_scan_mode=sweep, fast_axes: ['energy', 'kx']; slow_axes: ['energy'] is allowed.

field.name: slow_axes
field.doc: List of the axes that are acquired by scanning a physical parameter, listed in order of decreasing speed. See fast_axes for examples.

field.name: depends_on
field.doc: Refers to the last transformation specifying the positon of the manipulator in the NXtransformations chain.

group.doc: Collection of axis-based translations and rotations to describe the location and geometry of the manipulator as a component in the instrument. Conventions from the NXtransformations base class are used. In principle, the McStas coordinate system is used. The first transformation has to point either to another component of the system or . (for pointing to the reference frame) to relate it relative to the experimental setup. Typically, the components of a system should all be related relative to each other and only one component should relate to the reference coordinate system.
